name: Assimulated
description: The Cerritos crew are under the microscope once more, failing their drills for real this time. Captain Freeman sends them to practice in brand new drill pods, but some crew are leaving the pods with more than freshly sharpened skills.
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Augments, Federation, and Ferengi Alliance Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using La Sirena Borg Queen, any version of Boimler, Rutherford, or Borg will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: La Sirena Borg Queen, Boimler, Rutherford, or Borg
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Bashir
featured_crew.flavor: Bashir was assimilated… Is it a terrible reality or just a bad joke? Who knows.

action.name: I'm a Doctor, Not a Borg Drone. Oh, wait...

featured_crew.name: Boimler
featured_crew.flavor: Boimler finds himself completely assimilated by the Borg during a holoprogram drill. And all he wanted was just to get a perfect score.

featured_crew.name: Rutherford
featured_crew.flavor: Rutherford uses his custom holodeck program to help Tendi learn how to spacewalk. Lessons were learned.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Boimler
rewards.flavor: Bradward Boimler is a command ensign on the USS Cerritos. He is desperate to prove himself a competent and valuable member of the crew.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Bashir
rewards.flavor: Bashir was assimilated… Is it a terrible reality or just a bad joke? Who knows.

action.name: I'm a Doctor, Not a Borg Drone. Oh, wait...

rewards.name: Rutherford
rewards.flavor: Rutherford uses his custom holodeck program to help Tendi learn how to spacewalk. Lessons were learned.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

adventures.name: Blockade
adventures.description: Upgrade pod exteriors to block out unwanted interference.

adventures.name: Wavelength
adventures.description: Obtain data on the frequency the Borg are using.

adventures.name: Interloper
adventures.description: Investigate who has accessed the drill pods.

adventures.name: Disruption
adventures.description: Get rid of the interference plaguing the drill pods.

rewards.name: Assimulated
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

adventures.name: Secured Perimeter
adventures.description: Update security programs to keep out unwanted influence.

adventures.name: Blockade
adventures.description: Upgrade pod exteriors to block out unwanted interference.

adventures.name: Overload
adventures.description: Overload the drones with an abundance of data.

adventures.name: Disruption
adventures.description: Get rid of the interference plaguing the drill pods.

rewards.name: Assimulated
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: Rutherford
rewards.flavor: Rutherford uses his custom holodeck program to help Tendi learn how to spacewalk. Lessons were learned.

rewards.name: Boimler
rewards.flavor: Boimler finds himself completely assimilated by the Borg during a holoprogram drill. And all he wanted was just to get a perfect score.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "Hey, uh, Captain? We could use some help here! Our crew failed our drills again and the captain's making us do overtime in the drill pods. But, well, people are coming out weird. Like--"
"There you are. Surrender yourself to the Borg. Resistance is futile."

"Like that! Thanks Boimler. See what I mean, Captain? People around here are acting all weird and Borg-y after they come out of the pods. But the captain's so focused on everyone getting 100%, she won't believe me about the whole Borg thing. Think you can help?"
"Hey, uh, Captain? We could use some help here! Our crew failed our drills again and the captain's making us do overtime in the drill pods. But, well, people are coming out weird. Like--"
"There you are. Surrender yourself to the Borg. Resistance is futile."

"Like that! Thanks Boimler. See what I mean, Captain? People around here are acting all weird and Borg-y after they come out of the pods. But the captain's so focused on everyone getting 100%, she won't believe me about the whole Borg thing. Think you can help?"
"Whew. Thank you, Captain. I'm gonna be feeling that optical implant for awhile though, yowch!"

responses.text: "How are the crew members who were affected by the pods?"
"So, what are you charging for drone daycare?"

screens.text: "Oh, these? Yeah, we're still having some issues with the drills. It seems whatever outside influence started this is still around, despite all the work you did on the pods."

"Thanks to the investigation your crew assisted with, it's a pretty sure bet the Borg are behind this. But why or how? Those are still questions we need answered. We tried swapping out the pods, but we are still having the same issues."

"Doctor T'Ana's got her hands full in sickbay, but thanks to all the help, many people seem to be making a full recovery. Though I did overhear Westlake saying something about overdoing it on hypospray-induced comas...but I'm sure it's nothing."
"Captain, you know we've moved beyond the acquisition of wealth! Besides, whatever anyone would pay me wouldn't be enough! Have you ever had to remove a tricorder component from a baby drone's nose?"
"Stop trying to assimilate me, you Borg brats! Captain, please, hurry up and put a stop to whatever's causing this!"
"Whew. Thank you, Captain. I'm gonna be feeling that optical implant for awhile though, yowch!"
